casebody.data:
BOWNS, Respondent, v. STEWART, Appellant. (City Court of New York,

General Term.

May 22, 1899.) Action by Henry E. Bowns against Samuel Stewart. There was judgment for plaintiff, from which defendant appeals. Affirmed. John H. Rogan, for appellant. Putney & Bishop, for respondent PER CURIAM.

We have examined the case, and points submitted, and do not find any error-committed. We therefore think the judgment should be affirmed, with costs.
